data.title: What is the reason for some people having two family names and others having only one family surname without a personal given name?
data.meta_description: Answer (1 of 2): The presence of two family names is often influenced by cultural practices and naming conventions. In some cultures, individuals inherit both the paternal and maternal surnames, creating a compound or double-barreled surname. In contrast, others follow a tradition of using a sing...
